page.title: 16Shopping in Kidderminster 1
page.content: {Kidderminster Town Centre}seems quite large to us, but compared with Birmingham and Worcester shopping centres it is in fact small. Although Kidderminster has a variety of shops it is lacking in a variety of stock so the range of goods offered is limited. For food, there are several large {supermarkets}including{Sainsbury's}and {Waitrose.}In the last few years some smaller food stores have closed down because of the competition from the supermarkets. Kidderminster has two {department stores, Owen Owen}and the {Co-op,}and has branches of several large{chains}including{Woolworth's, {Littlewood's, W.H.Smith's, Marks and {Spencer}and{Boots the Chemist.}There are also many smaller shops. Currently there are improvements being made in the Town Centre to make it safer; the High Street is now a{pedestrian area.
